answers.answer: I don't think you should be worried, that just means they'll take better care of you! My regular OBGYN doesn't do anatomy scans, so I'm going to a different doc as well :-)

I'm not sure why he did but on the bright side, you will get more then three u/s being high risk... I to am high risk due to getting preeclampsia with my first son but I have no signs of this pregnancy being high risk yet but Ive already had two u/s and by Oct I will have gotten two more  .. its nice seeing my little boy so much lol .. guess you could always ask them at your appt :)

I was sent to fetal diagnostic center to measure baby at 12 weeks and then again at 16 weeks. They checked for Down syndrome and other abnormalities. It was with a high risk doctor as well but I'm not high risk. It was just standard.

You're having twins right? Maybe it has something to do with that? I'm sure if it was something to worry about he would of told you.  Don't worry I'm sure everything is fine :) it might be slightly harder to do an anatomy scan of twins..

Oh no! No twins for me! Just a baby girl! But hopefully they're sending me there just because. Would have been nice to have had a heads up though! Instead of stressing me out about it! I had a voluntary scan a week ago to find out gender but haven't had one by a Dr since8 weeks. so I hope she's as big as she's supposed to be!

question: Any idea why my doctor has scheduled my anatomy scan with a high risk doctor?? I have fibroids but from the get go he said I should be fine and has never mentioned me being high risk. They just left a voicemail to give me directions and said its with a high risk doctor. Slightly freaked out now. Any ideas??
title: high risk ultrasound
